overview.problem: Students struggle to discover events, connect with peers, and access campus services efficiently. Existing solutions were fragmented across multiple platforms, leading to poor engagement and missed opportunities.
overview.impact: Won multiple national awards and became the go-to platform for student lifestyle management at our university.

myRole.title: Lead Developer & Project Manager
responsibilities: Architected the entire React Native application structure
Led daily standups and sprint planning with 4-person team
Implemented core features: event discovery, social networking, and campus services integration
Coordinated with university stakeholders for requirements gathering
Presented at national competitions and pitch events

architecture.description: Built on React Native for cross-platform compatibility with Firebase backend

components.name: Mobile App (React Native)
components.details: Cross-platform iOS/Android app with offline-first architecture

components.name: Firebase Backend
components.details: Real-time database, authentication, and cloud functions

components.name: University API Integration
components.details: Connected to campus services for timetables, facilities, and events

keyFeatures.title: Real-time Event Discovery
keyFeatures.description: Students receive instant notifications about campus events matching their interests

keyFeatures.title: Social Networking
keyFeatures.description: Connect with peers, form study groups, and share experiences

keyFeatures.title: Campus Services Hub
keyFeatures.description: One-stop access to library bookings, gym schedules, and dining menus

challenges.description: Initial implementation caused lag when handling 500+ concurrent users during peak event times
challenges.solution: Implemented pagination, data throttling, and optimistic UI updates. Reduced load time by 60%.
challenges.learned: Importance of scalability planning from day one

challenges.description: iOS and Android users expected platform-specific UI patterns
challenges.solution: Created adaptive component library that respected platform conventions while maintaining brand identity
challenges.learned: User experience trumps design consistency when it comes to platform expectations

challenges.description: Managing 4 developers with varying skill levels and schedules
challenges.solution: Implemented agile methodology with 2-week sprints, code reviews, and pair programming sessions
challenges.learned: Clear communication and documentation are essential for team success

metrics.label: Event Engagement
metrics.description: Increase in event attendance compared to previous year

whatWentWell: Strong team collaboration and agile practices
Scalable architecture that handled rapid growth
whatCouldImprove: Earlier user testing would have caught UX issues sooner
More comprehensive error logging for production debugging
keyTakeaways: Understanding user needs is more important than technical complexity
Leadership is about empowering your team, not doing everything yourself
Building for scale from the start saves months of refactoring later
